[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: verify_transaction_info()] [Future transaction proof] Can proving a transaction at the current ledger_info.version() (boundary case) allow unfinalized transactions to appear finalized? (High)
[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Type: Version] [Version type safety] Is Version strongly typed to prevent confusion with other u64 values like block height or timestamp? (Low)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Type: TransactionAccumulatorInternalNode] [Accumulator fork] Can an attacker create two different accumulator trees with the same root hash but different transaction orderings? (Critical)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: verify_transaction_info()] [Historical proof validation] Can old proofs from historical ledger states be replayed to prove transactions that were later reversed or modified? (Medium)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Type: EventAccumulatorInternalNode] [Event accumulator consistency] Are event accumulators per-transaction or global, and can this be exploited to prove events from wrong transactions? (High)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Import: TransactionAccumulatorHasher] [Hasher collision resistance] Does TransactionAccumulatorHasher provide 128-bit collision resistance against birthday attacks? (High)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Import: SparseMerkleInternalHasher] [Second preimage attacks] Can attackers find second preimages for SparseMerkleInternalHasher outputs to forge Merkle branches? (Critical)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Import: EventAccumulatorHasher] [Length extension] Is EventAccumulatorHasher vulnerable to length extension attacks that could append malicious data to event proofs? (High)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Derive: CryptoHasher for SparseMerkleLeafNode] [Domain separation] Does the CryptoHasher implementation use proper domain separation between leaf and internal node hashes? (Critical)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: verify_transaction_info()] [Consensus integration] Does verify_transaction_info enforce that ledger_info has a valid BFT quorum certificate before trusting proofs? (Critical)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Type: TransactionInfo] [Transaction finality] Does TransactionInfo include sufficient data to prove transaction finality, or can pending transactions be proven as finalized? (Critical)
[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Type: LedgerInfo] [Ledger info freshness] Can stale ledger_info be used to verify outdated proofs, allowing validators to operate on divergent state? (High)
[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: verify_transaction_info()] [Empty proof] What happens when ledger_info_to_transaction_info_proof contains zero siblings - is this valid for genesis? (Medium)
[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: MerkleTreeInternalNode::hash()] [Identical children] Can an internal node have left_child == right_child, and does this create validation issues? (Low)
[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: SparseMerkleLeafNode::new()] [Duplicate values] Can two leaves have the same value_hash but different keys, and how does this affect tree uniqueness? (Low)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Struct: MerkleTreeInternalNode] [Null hash values] Can HashValue::zero() or HashValue::default() be used as legitimate child hashes, or should they be rejected? (Medium)
[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Module: proptest_proof] [Property testing coverage] Are the proptest implementations comprehensive enough to catch all edge cases in proof verification? (Low)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: verify_transaction_info()] [Deterministic verification] Is proof verification fully deterministic across all validators, or can non-determinism cause consensus failures? (Critical)
[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [All types] [Upgrade compatibility] Can changes to hash functions or proof structures be safely deployed without breaking existing proofs in the accumulator? (High)
[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Module structure] [Public API surface] Does the module expose too much internal state through public exports, allowing bypasses of intended security checks? (Medium)
